intro: Asperula graveolens subsp. danilewskiana, commonly known as the sweet woodruff, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and fragrant, small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces distinctive, boat-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value and aromatic properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and used in traditional herbal remedies.
